description: From French d√©puter, from Latin deputo.

verbs.description: depute (third-person singular simple present deputes, present participle deputing, simple past and past participle deputed)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To assign (someone or something) to or for something.
To delegate (a task, etc.) to a subordinate.
examples: Will Wyatt having moved up a notch, the project was deputed to a second team of producers whose judgement I didn't trust.

entries.meaning: To deputize (someone), to appoint as deputy.
examples: There is no man deputed of the king to hear thee.

entries.meaning: To appoint; to assign; to choose.
examples: The most conspicuous places in cities are usually deputed for the erection of statues.
